title: U.S. EIA's International Energy Outlook 2021
description: Join us for the launch of the IEO2021, a report on the long-term projections of world energy supply and demand by region and primary energy source; electricity generation by energy source; and energy-related carbon dioxide emissions.

title: Chinese Views on the Biden Administration’s China Trade Policy
description: Please join the Trustee Chair in Chinese Business & Economics for a discussion of the Chinese views on the Biden administration's China trade policy.

title: The Evening: Blinken in Paris, Crimes Against Humanity in Libya, Streetcar Uptown, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Blinken in Paris, Crimes Against Humanity in Libya, Streetcar Uptown, and More.

title: Security Challenges of Climate Change in Southeast Asia
description: A 1.5-degree Celsius increase in global warming poses an immediate threat to Southeast Asia's economic, political, and health security. Mitigating the effects of climate change is key to the United States' goal to secure a free, open, and prosperous Indo-Pacific.

title: OPEC Stays the Course despite Rising Oil Prices
description: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies in OPEC+ are sticking with their production plans despite the run-up in oil prices, ignoring market pressure for even greater volumes.

title: Competing Views of the United States
description: Jon Alterman talks with Emile Hokayem about changing Middle Eastern views of the United States.

title: First Takes: Our Initial Reactions to USTR Tai’s CSIS Speech on China Policy
description: The Trustee Chair in Chinese Business and Economics resident and non-resident experts provide their initial take on USTR Tai's CSIS speech on China policy.

title: The Future of Women and Girls in Afghanistan
description: Please join the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) on Thursday, September 30 from 1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m. EDT for a discussion on the future of women and girls in Afghanistan in the wake of the Taliban’s ascendance in Kabul.

title: Afghanistan’s Future: Assessing the National Security, Humanitarian and Economic Implications of the Taliban Takeover
description: Sue Eckert testifies before the Senate Banking Committee on the future of Afghanistan and the humanitarian implications of the Taliban takeover.

title: The Evening: California Oil Spill, Facebook Goes Down, Takin’ It To The Streets, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the California Oil Spill, Facebook Goes Down, Takin’ It To The Streets, and More.

title: Pittsburgh is Back!
description: This week, the Scholl Chair recaps the inaugural Trade and Technology Council meeting in Pittsburgh. Where can the United States and European Union cooperate, and where do our policies differ from theirs?

title: A Conversation with Jordanian Finance Minister Mohamad al-Ississ
description: Please join the Middle East Program at CSIS as Minister al-Ississ returns to discuss the status of economic security and development in Jordan a year in to the economic recovery plan he set in motion.
